1.verse: Paul, called to be an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and Sosthenes our brother,

2.verse: to the church of God that is in Corinth, to those sanctified in Christ Jesus and called to be saints together with all those in every place who call on the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, both their Lord and ours:

3.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: I am always giving thanks to my God for you because of the grace of God that was given to you in Christ Jesus,

5.verse: that in every way you were enriched in him in all speech and all knowledge—

6.verse: just as the testimony about Christ was confirmed among you—

7.verse: so that you do not lack in any spiritual gift as you wait for the revealing of our Lord Jesus Christ.

8.verse: He will keep you steadfast to the end, guiltless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.

9.verse: God is faithful, by whom you were called into fellowship with his Son, Jesus Christ our Lord.

10.verse: I appeal to you, brothers, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you all come to agreement and that there be no divisions among you, but that you be united in the same frame of mind and the same judgment.

11.verse: For it has been reported to me by members of Chloe’s household that there are quarrels among you, my brothers.

12.verse: What I mean is this: each of you is saying, “I am with Paul,” or, “I am with Apollos,” or, “I am with Cephas,” or, “I am with Christ.”

13.verse: Has Christ been divided? Was Paul crucified for you? Or were you baptized in the name of Paul?

14.verse: I thank God that I did not baptize any of you except Crispus and Gaius,

15.verse: so that no one can say that you were baptized in my name.

16.verse: (I also baptized the household of Stephanas; beyond that I do not know if I baptized anyone else.)

17.verse: For Christ did not send me to baptize but to preach the gospel, and not with eloquent wisdom, lest the cross of Christ be rendered ineffective.

18.verse: For the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.

19.verse: For it is written, “I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and the shrewdness of the intelligent I will thwart.”

20.verse: Where is the wise person? Where is the scholar? Where is the brilliant debater of this age? Has not God made foolish the wisdom of the world?

21.verse: For since in the wisdom of God the world did not come to know God through wisdom, God was pleased through the foolishness of what we preach to save those who believe.

22.verse: For Jews demand signs and Greeks are looking for wisdom,

23.verse: but we preach Christ crucified, a stumbling block to Jews and foolishness to Gentiles.

24.verse: Yet to those who are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ is the power of God and the wisdom of God.

25.verse: For the foolishness of God is wiser than the wisdom of men, and the weakness of God is stronger than the strength of men.

26.verse: Consider your calling, brothers: according to worldly standards, not many of you were wise, not many were influential, not many were of noble birth.

27.verse: But God chose the foolish things of the world to shame the wise; God chose the weak things of the world to shame the strong;

28.verse: God chose the things that the world considers insignificant and contemptible, what is regarded as nothing, to render useless the things that are,

29.verse: so that no one can boast in the presence of God.

30.verse: But you are of him in Christ Jesus, who became for us wisdom from God, and righteousness and sanctification and redemption,

31.verse: so that, as it is written, “Let the one who boasts, boast in the Lord.”

1.verse: When I came to you, brothers, I did not come with excellence of speech or of wisdom as I told you about the secret purpose of God.

2.verse: For I had decided to know nothing among you except Jesus Christ and him crucified.

3.verse: So I came to you in weakness and fear, and with much trembling.

4.verse: My word and my message were not delivered with persuasive words of wisdom, but with a demonstration of the Spirit and of power,

5.verse: so that your faith would not be based on the wisdom of men but on the power of God.

6.verse: However, we do speak wisdom among those who are mature, although it is not the wisdom of this age or of the rulers of this age, who are doomed to perish.

7.verse: Rather, we speak the wisdom of God; a wisdom that was hidden in mystery and that God had determined before the ages for our glory.

8.verse: None of the rulers of this age understood it, for if they had, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.

9.verse: But, as it is written, “No eye has seen, no ear has heard, nor has the mind of man imagined, the things that God has prepared for those who love him.”

10.verse: But God has revealed them to us through his Spirit; for the Spirit searches everything, even the deep things of God.

11.verse: For who among men can know the thoughts of a man except the man’s own spirit that is in him? In the same way, no one can understand the thoughts of God except the Spirit of God.

12.verse: It was not the spirit of the world that we received, but the Spirit sent from God, that we might understand the gifts freely given to us by God.

13.verse: And we speak about these things in words not taught by human wisdom but taught by the Spirit, expressing spiritual truths in spiritual words.

14.verse: The natural man does not receive the things of the Spirit of God, for they are foolishness to him; he cannot understand them because they are spiritually discerned.

15.verse: But the spiritual person discerns all things, and is not himself subject to anyone’s scrutiny.

16.verse: For, “Who has known the mind of the Lord, so as to advise him?” But we have the mind of Christ.

1.verse: And so, brothers, I could not speak to you as spiritual people, but rather as people of the flesh, as infants in Christ.

2.verse: I gave you milk, not solid food, for you were not ready for it. And even now you are not yet ready,

3.verse: for you are still of the flesh. For while there is jealousy and strife among you, are you not of the flesh and behaving like mere men?

4.verse: For when one says, “I follow Paul,” and another, “I follow Apollos,” are you not like everyone else?

5.verse: What then is Apollos? What is Paul? Servants through whom you came to believe, even as the Lord assigned to each of us.

6.verse: I planted, Apollos watered, but God has been causing the growth.

7.verse: So neither the one who plants nor the one who waters is anything, but God is the one who gives the growth.

8.verse: The one who plants and the one who waters have a common purpose, and each will receive his wages on the basis of his work.

9.verse: For we are coworkers belonging to God. You are God’s field, God’s building.

10.verse: According to the grace of God given to me, like a skilled master builder I laid a foundation, but someone else is building on it. Let each one take care how he builds on it.

11.verse: For no one is able to lay a foundation other than that which is laid, which is Jesus Christ.

12.verse: If anyone is building on the foundation with gold, silver, gems, wood, hay, straw—

13.verse: the work of each person will become evident, for the Day will disclose it, because it will be revealed by fire. And the fire will test what sort of work each has done.

14.verse: If the work that someone has built on it remains, he will receive a reward.

15.verse: If someone’s work is burned up, he will suffer loss; however, he himself will be saved, but only as through fire.

16.verse: Do you not know that you are God’s temple and that God’s Spirit lives in you?

17.verse: If anyone destroys God’s temple, God will destroy him. For God’s temple is holy, and that is what you are.

18.verse: Let no one deceive himself. If someone among you thinks he is wise in this age, let him become foolish so that he may become wise.

19.verse: For the wisdom of this world is folly with God. For it is written, “He traps the wise with their own craftiness.”

20.verse: And again, “The Lord knows the reasonings of the wise, that they are futile.”

21.verse: So then, let no one boast with respect to men. For all things are yours,

22.verse: whether Paul or Apollos or Cephas or the world or life or death or the present or the future—all are yours,

23.verse: and you are Christ’s, and Christ is God’s.

1.verse: This is how one should regard us, as servants of Christ and stewards of God’s mysteries.

2.verse: In this connection then, it is required of stewards that they be found trustworthy.

3.verse: But for me it is a matter of the least consequence that I should be judged by you or by any human court. In fact, I do not even judge myself.

4.verse: For I am not aware of anything against myself, yet not because of this am I acquitted. It is the Lord who judges me.

5.verse: So then, stop passing judgment on anything before the time, before the Lord comes. He will bring to light the hidden things of darkness and will disclose the motives of the heart. At that time praise will come to each from God.

6.verse: I have applied all this to myself and Apollos for your benefit, brothers, that you may learn by us not to go beyond what is written, that none of you may be puffed up in favor of one against another.

7.verse: For who sees anything superior in you? What do you have that you did not receive? And if you received it, why do you boast as if you did not receive it?

8.verse: Already you have all you want! Already you are rich! Without us you have begun to reign! And would that you did reign, so that we could reign with you!

9.verse: For it seems to me that God has displayed us, the apostles, last, as men sentenced to death, because we have become a spectacle to the world, both to angels and to men.

10.verse: We are fools for Christ, but you are men of wisdom in Christ! We are weak, but you are strong! You are distinguished, but we are dishonored!

11.verse: To this present hour we are hungry and thirsty, poorly clothed, knocked about, and homeless.

12.verse: We labor, working with our own hands. When reviled, we bless; when persecuted, we endure;

13.verse: when slandered, we respond kindly. We have become, as it were, the scum of the world, the refuse of all things, even now.

14.verse: I am not writing these things to shame you, but to admonish you as my dear children.

15.verse: For though you have innumerable guardians in Christ, you do not have many fathers, because I became your father in Christ Jesus through the gospel.

16.verse: I urge you, therefore, be imitators of me.

17.verse: That is why I sent to you Timothy, who is my beloved and faithful child in the Lord. He will remind you of my ways in Christ Jesus, as I teach them everywhere in every church.

18.verse: Some have become arrogant, as though I were not coming to you.

19.verse: But I will come to you soon, if the Lord wills, and I will find out not the speech of these arrogant people but their power.

20.verse: For the kingdom of God is not a matter of talk but of power.

21.verse: What would you prefer? Shall I come to you with a rod of correction or with love in a spirit of gentleness?

1.verse: It is actually reported that there is sexual immorality among you, a kind of immorality that is not tolerated even among Gentiles, for a man is living in sin with his father’s wife.

2.verse: And you are arrogant! Ought you not rather to have mourned, so that the man who did this deed would be removed from your midst?

3.verse: For though I am absent in body, I am present in spirit; and I have already passed judgment on the one who did this, just as though I were present.

4.verse: When you are assembled in the name of our Lord Jesus and I am with you in spirit, with the power of our Lord Jesus,

5.verse: hand this man over to Satan for the destruction of the flesh, so that the spirit may be saved on the Day of the Lord.

6.verse: Your boasting is not good. Do you not know that a little leaven leavens the whole batch of dough?

7.verse: Get rid of the old leaven so that you may be a new batch of dough, just as you really are unleavened. For Christ, our Passover lamb, has been sacrificed.

8.verse: So let us celebrate the festival, not with the old leaven, not with the leaven of malice and wickedness, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.

9.verse: I wrote to you in my letter not to associate with sexually immoral people—

10.verse: not at all meaning the sexually immoral of this world, or the greedy and swindlers, or idolaters, since then you would have to go out of the world.

11.verse: But now I am writing to you not to associate with anyone who bears the name of brother if he is a sexually immoral or greedy person, an idolater, slanderer, drunkard, or swindler—not even to eat with such a one.

12.verse: For what business is it of mine to judge outsiders? Is it not those inside the church that you are to judge?

13.verse: But God will judge those outside. “Remove the evil person from among you.”

1.verse: When any of you has a legal dispute against another, how dare he go to law before heathen judges and not before the saints?

2.verse: Or do you not know that the saints will judge the world? And if the world is to be judged by you, are you incompetent to try minor cases?

3.verse: Do you not know that we will judge angels, not to mention everyday affairs?

4.verse: So if you have ordinary cases, do you appoint as judges those who have no standing in the church?

5.verse: I say this to your shame! Is there no one among you wise enough to settle a dispute between his brothers,

6.verse: but brother goes to court against brother, and that before unbelievers?

7.verse: Already it is altogether a defeat for you, that you have lawsuits with one another. Why not rather be wronged? Why not rather be defrauded?

8.verse: But you yourselves wrong and defraud, and this to your own brothers!

9.verse: Do you not know that the unrighteous will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived: neither the sexually immoral, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor male prostitutes, nor homosexuals,

10.verse: nor thieves, nor the greedy, nor drunkards, nor slanderers, nor swindlers will inherit the kingdom of God.

11.verse: And some of you were guilty of these abominations! But you were washed, you were sanctified, you were justified in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and by the Spirit of our God.

12.verse: “All things are lawful for me,”—but not all things are helpful. “All things are lawful for me”—but I will not be overpowered by anything.

13.verse: “Food is for the stomach and the stomach is for food”—and God will destroy both the one and the other. But the body is not for sexual immorality, but for the Lord, and the Lord for the body;

14.verse: and God both has raised the Lord and will raise us up by his power.

15.verse: Do you not know that your bodies are members of Christ? Shall I then take the members of Christ and make them members of a prostitute? Never!

16.verse: Or do you not know that he who joins himself to a prostitute is one body with her? For it says, “The two will become one flesh.”

17.verse: But the one who joins himself to the Lord is one spirit with him.

18.verse: Flee sexual immorality! Every other sin a person commits is outside the body, but the sexually immoral person sins against his own body.

19.verse: Or do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit who is in you, whom you have received from God, and you are not your own?

20.verse: For you were bought with a price; therefore glorify God with your body.

1.verse: Now concerning the matters you wrote about. Yes, “It is good for a man not to have sexual contact with a woman.”

2.verse: But because of cases of sexual immorality, each man should have his own wife and each woman her own husband.

3.verse: The husband should fulfill his marital responsibility to his wife, and likewise the wife to her husband.

4.verse: For the wife does not have authority over her own body, but the husband does. In the same way, the husband does not have authority over his own body, but the wife does.

5.verse: Do not deprive one another, except perhaps by agreement for a set time, so that you may devote yourselves to prayer; then come together again, so that Satan may not tempt you because of your lack of self-control.

6.verse: This I say by way of concession, not of command.

7.verse: I wish that all men were as I myself am. But each has his own gift from God, one of one kind and one of another.

8.verse: Now to the unmarried and to the widows I say that it is good for them if they remain single, as I am.

9.verse: But if they are not practicing self-control, they should marry; for it is better to marry than to burn with sexual passion.

10.verse: To the married I give this command (not I, but the Lord): a wife should not separate from her husband

11.verse: (however if she does, let her remain unmarried or else be reconciled to her husband), and a husband should not divorce his wife.

12.verse: To the rest I say (I, not the Lord): If some brother has a wife who is not a believer, and she is willing to live with him, he should not divorce her.

13.verse: And if some woman has a husband who is not a believer, and he is willing to live with her, she should not divorce him.

14.verse: For the unbelieving husband is consecrated through union with his wife, and the unbelieving wife is consecrated through union with her husband. Otherwise your children would be defiled, but as it is, they are holy.

15.verse: But if the unbelieving partner separates, let it be so. In such cases the brother or the sister is not bound. It is to peace that God has called us.

16.verse: For how do you know, wife, whether you will save your husband? Or how do you know, husband, whether you will save your wife?

17.verse: Only, as the Lord has assigned to each person, as God has called each one, so let that person conduct his life. And thus I prescribe in all the churches.

18.verse: If a man was already circumcised when he was called, he should not conceal his circumcision. If a man was not circumcised when he was called, he should not submit to circumcision.

19.verse: Circumcision is nothing and uncircumcision is nothing. Rather, it is keeping God’s commandments that counts.

20.verse: Let each person continue in that condition in which he was called.

21.verse: If you were a slave when called, do not be concerned about it. However, if you are able to gain your freedom, make the most of the opportunity.

22.verse: For the one who was called by the Lord as a slave is a freedman of the Lord. Likewise, the one who was called as a free person is a slave of Christ.

23.verse: You were bought with a price; do not become slaves of men.

24.verse: Each one in the condition in which he was called, brothers, in that condition let him remain with God.

25.verse: Now concerning virgins: I have no command from the Lord, but I give my opinion as one who has been shown mercy by the Lord and is trustworthy.

26.verse: I think, then, that this is good because of the present distress—that it is good for a man to remain as he is.

27.verse: If you are married to a wife, do not seek to be set free; if you are free from a wife, do not seek a wife.

28.verse: But if you do marry, you have not sinned, and if a virgin marries, she has not sinned. However those who do marry will have worldly trouble, and I am trying to spare you.

29.verse: And I say this, my brothers: the time has grown short. From now on those who have wives should be as though they had none,

30.verse: and those who mourn as though they were not mourning, and those who rejoice as though they were not rejoicing, and those who buy as though they had no possessions,

31.verse: and those who use the world as though they were not absorbed in it. For the form of this world is passing away.

32.verse: I want you to be free from concern. An unmarried man is concerned about the things of the Lord, how to please the Lord.

33.verse: But a married man is concerned about the things of the world, how to please his wife,

34.verse: and he is divided. An unmarried woman or a virgin is concerned about the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and spirit. But a married woman is concerned about the things of the world, how to please her husband.

35.verse: I am saying this for your benefit, not to put a restraint on you, but to promote propriety and undivided devotion to the Lord.

36.verse: If someone believes he is not treating his virgin in an appropriate manner, if his passions are strong, and so it has to be, he should do what he desires, it is no sin—let them marry.

37.verse: However, the man who stands firm in his resolve is under no compulsion but has control over his desire, and has determined this in his heart to keep her as his virgin, he will do well.

38.verse: So then the one who marries his virgin does well, and the one who does not marry will do even better.

39.verse: A wife is bound for such a time as her husband is alive. But if her husband should die, she is free to marry whom she wishes, only in the Lord.

40.verse: But in my opinion she will be happier if she remains as she is. And I believe that I too have the Spirit of God.

1.verse: Now concerning food sacrificed to idols: we know that “we all have knowledge.” Knowledge puffs up, but love builds up.

2.verse: If someone presumes to know something, he does not yet know as he ought to know.

3.verse: But if someone loves God, he is known by God.

4.verse: Therefore, as to the eating of food sacrificed to idols, we know that “an idol has no genuine reality” and that “there is no God but one.”

5.verse: For even if there are so-called gods, whether in heaven or on earth (as indeed there are many “gods” and many “lords”),

6.verse: yet for us there is but one God, the Father, from whom are all things and for whom we exist, and one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom are all things and through whom we exist.

7.verse: However, not everyone has this knowledge. But some, because in former times they were involved with idols, eat this food as though it were an idol sacrifice, and thus their conscience, being weak, is defiled.

8.verse: Food does not bring us close to God. We are no worse if we do not eat, and no better if we do.

9.verse: But take care that this right of yours does not become a stumbling block to the weak.

10.verse: For if someone should see you who have knowledge, dining in an idol’s temple, will not the conscience of the one who is weak be emboldened to eat food sacrificed to idols?

11.verse: And so the one who is weak, the brother for whom Christ died, will be destroyed by your knowledge.

12.verse: So when you sin against your brothers and wound their conscience, being weak, you are sinning against Christ.

13.verse: Therefore, if food causes my brother to stumble, I will never eat meat, lest I cause my brother to stumble.

1.verse: Am I not free? Am I not an apostle? Have I not seen Jesus our Lord? Are you not the result of my labor in the Lord?

2.verse: If to others I am not an apostle, at least I am to you, for you are the proof of my apostleship in the Lord.

3.verse: This is my defense to those who sit in judgment on me.

4.verse: Do we not have the right to eat and drink?

5.verse: Do we not have the right to the company of a believing wife, as also the other apostles, the Lord’s brothers, and Cephas do?

6.verse: Or is it only I and Barnabas who have no right to refrain from working?

7.verse: Who ever serves in the army at his own expense? Who plants a vineyard and does not eat its fruit? Or who tends a flock and does not drink of its milk?

8.verse: Am I saying these things from a merely human point of view? Or does not the Law say the same?

9.verse: For in the Law of Moses it is written, “You shall not muzzle an ox while it is treading out the grain.” It is not for oxen that God is concerned, is it?

10.verse: Or does he not speak entirely for our sake. To be sure, it was written for our sake, because the one plowing should plow in hope and the one threshing thresh in hope of sharing in the crop.

11.verse: If we sowed spiritual things among you, is it too much if we reap material things from you?

12.verse: If others have a share in this right over you, do not we even more? Nevertheless, we have not made use of this right, but endure all things lest we place some obstacle in the way of the gospel of Christ.

13.verse: Do you not know that those who perform sacred rites in the temple eat food from the temple, and those who serve at the altar share in the sacrificial offerings?

14.verse: In the same way, the Lord gave instructions to those who proclaim the gospel that they should get their living from the gospel.

15.verse: But I have not used any of these rights. And I am not writing this so that something will be done for me; for it would be better for me rather to die—no one shall take away my ground for boasting!

16.verse: If I preach the gospel, I do not have a ground for boasting, for I am compelled to do so. Woe is me if I do not preach the gospel!

17.verse: For if I do this willingly, I have a reward. But if unwillingly, I have been entrusted with a charge.

18.verse: What then is my reward? That when I preach I may present the gospel free of charge, and so not make full use of my right in the gospel.

19.verse: For though I am free from all, I have made myself a servant to all, so that I might win as many as possible.

20.verse: To the Jews I became as a Jew that I might win Jews. To those under the law I became as one under the law (though I myself am not under the law) that I might win those under the law.

21.verse: To those outside the law I became as one outside the law (though I am not free from the law of God but subject to the law of Christ) that I might win those outside the law.

22.verse: To the weak I became weak that I might win the weak. I have become all things to all people, that by all means I might save some.

23.verse: I do all things for the sake of the gospel, that I may share with them in its benefits.

24.verse: Do you not know that all who run in the stadium compete but only one receives the prize? So run that you may win.

25.verse: Everyone who competes exercises self-control in all things. They do it to receive a perishable wreath, but we for an imperishable one.

26.verse: So I do not run aimlessly; I do not box like one flailing the air.

27.verse: But I discipline my body and bring it into subjection, so that having preached to others I myself should not be disqualified.

1.verse: For I do not want you to be unaware, brothers, that our fathers were all under the cloud and all passed through the sea,

2.verse: and all were baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea,

3.verse: and all ate the same spiritual food,

4.verse: and all drank the same spiritual drink; for they used to drink from the spiritual rock that followed them, and that rock was Christ.

5.verse: But with most of them God was not pleased, for their corpses were scattered over the desert.

6.verse: Now these things took place as examples for us, so that we would not crave evil things, even as they did.

7.verse: So do not become idolaters, as some of them were. As it is written, “The people sat down to eat and drink and rose up to play.”

8.verse: We must not indulge in sexual immorality, as some of them did, and twenty-three thousand fell in a single day.

9.verse: And let us not put Christ to the test, as some of them did, and were destroyed by serpents.

10.verse: And do not grumble, as some of them did, and were killed by the destroyer.

11.verse: Now these events happened to them as examples, but were written down as warnings for us, on whom the end of the ages has come.

12.verse: So let the one who thinks he stands watch out lest he fall.

13.verse: No trial has overtaken you that is not distinctively human; and God is faithful; he will not let you be tested beyond what you can bear, but with the trial will also provide the way through, so that you will be able to endure it.

14.verse: Therefore, my dear friends, flee from the worship of idols.

15.verse: I speak as to sensible people; judge for yourselves what I am about to say.

16.verse: The cup of blessing that we bless, is it not a sharing in the blood of Christ? The bread that we break, is it not a sharing in the body of Christ?

17.verse: Because there is one loaf, we who are many are one body, for we all partake of the one loaf.

18.verse: Consider Israel according to the flesh: are not those who eat the sacrifices sharers in the altar?

19.verse: So what am I implying? That food offered to idols is anything, or that an idol is anything?

20.verse: No, what I am implying is that the things that people sacrifice, they sacrifice to demons and not to God; and I do not want you to be sharers with demons.

21.verse: You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons; you cannot partake of the table of the Lord and the table of demons.

22.verse: Or are we trying to provoke the Lord to jealousy? Are we stronger than he?

23.verse: “All things are permissible,” but not all things are helpful. “All things are permissible,” but not all things build up.

24.verse: Let no one seek his own advantage, but that of the other.

25.verse: Eat whatever is sold in the marketplace, asking no question based on conscience,

26.verse: for the earth and its fullness belong to the Lord.

27.verse: If one of the unbelievers invites you to a meal and you decide to go, eat whatever is set before you, asking no question based on conscience.

28.verse: However, if someone should say to you, “This has been offered in sacrifice,” then do not eat it, for the sake of the one who told you, and for the sake of conscience—

29.verse: I mean the conscience of the other person, not your own. Why then should my liberty be determined by the conscience of another?

30.verse: If I partake with thankfulness, why am I blamed because of that for which I give thanks?

31.verse: So, whether you eat or drink, or whatever you do, do everything for the glory of God.

32.verse: Do not be a stumbling block to either Jews or Greeks, or to the church of God;

33.verse: even as I try to please everyone in everything I do, not seeking my own advantage but that of the many, so that they may be saved.

1.verse: Be imitators of me, as I also am of Christ.

2.verse: I commend you because you remember me in everything and hold firmly to the traditions just as I passed them on to you.

3.verse: But I want you to understand that the head of every man is Christ, and the head of a wife is her husband, and the head of Christ is God.

4.verse: Any man who prays or prophesies with his head covered disgraces his head,

5.verse: but any wife who prays or prophesies with her head uncovered disgraces her head, for it is one and the same as a woman who has her head shaved.

6.verse: For if a woman will not cover her head, she should cut her hair short. But if it is disgraceful for a woman to have her hair cut short or have her head shaved, she should cover her head.

7.verse: For a man should not have his head covered, since he is the image and glory of God, but woman is the glory of man.

8.verse: For man did not come from woman, but woman from man.

9.verse: Neither was man created for woman, but woman for man.

10.verse: For this reason a woman ought to have a sign of authority on her head, because of the angels.

11.verse: Nevertheless, in the Lord woman is not independent of man nor is man independent of woman;

12.verse: for just as the woman came from man, so also the man now comes through woman. And all things come from God.

13.verse: Judge for yourselves: is it proper for a wife to pray to God with her head uncovered?

14.verse: Does not nature itself teach you that if a man has long hair, it is a disgrace for him,

15.verse: but if a woman has long hair, it is her glory? For her long hair is given to her for a covering.

16.verse: If anyone is inclined to be quarrelsome, we have no such practice, nor do the churches of God.

17.verse: But in giving the following instructions I do not commend you, because when you come together it is not for the better but for the worse.

18.verse: For in the first place, I hear that when you gather as a church there are divisions among you, and in part I believe it,

19.verse: for there must be factions among you so that it may become clear who among you are genuine.

20.verse: Therefore when you gather in the assembly, it is not to eat a supper in honor of the Lord.

21.verse: For when it comes time to eat, each one goes ahead with his own supper; and one remains hungry while another becomes drunk.

22.verse: Can it be that you do not have houses in which to eat and drink? Or are you trying to show contempt for the church of God by humiliating those who have nothing? What should I say to you? Should I commend you? For this I will not commend you.

23.verse: For I received from the Lord that which I also passed on to you: that the Lord Jesus on the night when he was betrayed took bread,

24.verse: and after giving thanks, he broke it, and said, “This is my body which is for you. Do this in remembrance of me.”

25.verse: In the same way, he took the cup also, after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in my blood. Do this, as often as you drink it, in remembrance of me.”

26.verse: For as often as you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the Lord’s death until he comes.

27.verse: Whoever, therefore, eats this bread or drinks this cup of the Lord in an unworthy manner will be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord.

28.verse: A person should examine himself, then, and so eat of the bread and drink of the cup.

29.verse: For the one who eats and drinks without discerning the body eats and drinks judgment on himself.

30.verse: That is why many of you are weak and sick, and quite a few are dead.

31.verse: But if we had been examining ourselves, we would not come under judgment.

32.verse: But when we are judged by the Lord, we are being corrected by discipline, so that we will not be condemned along with the world.

33.verse: So then, my brothers, when you come together to eat, wait for one another.

34.verse: If anyone is hungry, he should eat at home, so that when you come together it does not lead to judgment. I will give directions about other matters when I come.

1.verse: Now concerning spiritual gifts, brothers, I do not want you to be uninformed.

2.verse: You know that when you were pagans you were somehow seduced and led astray to idols that could not speak.

3.verse: Therefore I want you to understand that no one speaking by the Spirit of God says, “Jesus is accursed!” and no one can say, “Jesus is Lord,” except by the Holy Spirit.

4.verse: Now there are different kinds of gifts, but the same Spirit;

5.verse: and there are different kinds of ministries, but the same Lord;

6.verse: and there are different accomplishments, but it is the same God who produces all of them in everyone.

7.verse: But the manifestation of the Spirit is given to each one for the good of all.

8.verse: For to one is given through the Spirit a message of wisdom, to another a message of knowledge according to the same Spirit,

9.verse: to another faith by the same Spirit, to another gifts of healing by the one Spirit,

10.verse: to another performance of miracles, to another prophecy, to another discerning of spirits, to another various kinds of tongues, and to another interpretation of tongues.

11.verse: But it is the one and same Spirit, distributing to each as he determines, who produces all these things.

12.verse: For just as the physical body is one yet has many members, and all the members of the body, though many, are one body, so also is the body of Christ.

13.verse: For in one Spirit we were all baptized into one body, whether Jews or Greeks, slaves or free, and we were all imbued with one Spirit.

14.verse: For indeed the body is not a single member, but many.

15.verse: If the foot should say, “Since I am not a hand, I am not part of the body,” it would not for that reason cease to be part of the body.

16.verse: And if the ear should say, “Since I am not an eye, I am not part of the body,” it would not for that reason cease to be part of the body.

17.verse: If the whole body were an eye, where would the sense of hearing be? If the whole body were an ear, where would the sense of smell be?

18.verse: But as it is, God arranged the members in the body, every one of them, just as he chose.

19.verse: If they were all a single member, where would the body be?

20.verse: But as it is, there are many members, but one body.

21.verse: The eye cannot say to the hand, “I have no need of you”; nor again the head to the feet, “I have no need of you.”

22.verse: Quite the contrary, those members of the body that seem to be weaker are indispensable,

23.verse: and those members of the body that we consider less honorable we clothe with greater honor, and our unpresentable members are treated with greater modesty,

24.verse: whereas our presentable members have no such need. Instead, God has so arranged the body, giving greater honor to the member that lacked it,

25.verse: so that there would be no division in the body, but that the members would have the same care for one another.

26.verse: And if one member suffers, every member suffers with it; if one member is honored, every member rejoices with it.

27.verse: Now you are Christ’s body and each of you is a member of it.

28.verse: And God has appointed in the church first apostles, second prophets, third teachers, then miracles, then gifts of healing, those able to help others, those who can provide guidance, and various kinds of tongues.

29.verse: Not all are apostles, are they? Not all are prophets, are they? Not all are teachers, are they? Not all work miracles, do they?

30.verse: Not all have gifts of healing, do they? Not all speak in tongues, do they? Not all are able to interpret, are they?

31.verse: Set your hearts then on the higher gifts. And now I will show you a way that is beyond comparison.

1.verse: If I speak in the tongues of men and of angels, but do not have love, I am a resounding gong or a clanging cymbal.

2.verse: And if I have the gift of prophecy, and understand all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have all faith so that I can remove mountains, but do not have love, I am nothing.

3.verse: If I give away everything I own, and if I surrender my body to be burned, but do not have love, it benefits me nothing.

4.verse: Love is patient, love is kind, it does not envy. Love does not brag, it is not arrogant,

5.verse: it is not rude, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no account of wrongs,

6.verse: it takes no pleasure in wrongdoing, but rejoices in the truth.

7.verse: Love bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.

8.verse: Love never comes to an end. But if there are prophecies, they will be set aside; if there are tongues, they will cease; if there is knowledge, it will be set aside.

9.verse: For we know in part and we prophesy in part,

10.verse: but when what is complete comes, the partial will be set aside.

11.verse: When I was a child, I talked like a child, I thought like a child, I reasoned like a child. When I became a man, I set aside childish ways.

12.verse: For the present we are looking through a mirror obscurely, but then face to face. Now I know in part; then I will know fully, just as I have been fully known.

13.verse: And now remain faith, hope, and love; these three. And the greatest of these is love.

1.verse: Pursue love, and earnestly desire the spiritual gifts, but especially that you may prophesy.

2.verse: For the one speaking in a tongue speaks not to men but to God; indeed, no one understands him, yet he is speaking mysteries by the Spirit.

3.verse: On the other hand, the one who prophesies speaks to people for their edification, encouragement, and consolation.

4.verse: The one who speaks in a tongue edifies himself, but the one who prophesies edifies the church.

5.verse: Now I would like all of you to speak in tongues, but even more to prophesy. The one who prophesies is greater than the one who speaks in tongues, unless he interprets so that the church may receive edification.

6.verse: But as it is, brothers, if I come to you speaking in tongues, how will I benefit you unless I impart to you some revelation or knowledge or prophecy or teaching?

7.verse: It is the same with lifeless things that produce sound, whether flute or harp; if they do not make a difference between notes, how will what is being played on the flute or the harp be understood?

8.verse: Again, if the bugle gives an uncertain call, who will get ready for battle?

9.verse: So it is with you; if you do not speak a clear message with your tongue, how will anyone know what is being said? You will be speaking into the air.

10.verse: There are who-knows-how-many kinds of languages in the world, and none is without meaning.

11.verse: But if I do not grasp the meaning of the language, I will be a foreigner to the speaker and the speaker a foreigner to me.

12.verse: So it is with you. Since you are eager for manifestations of the Spirit, seek to excel for the edification of the church.

13.verse: For this reason, the one who speaks in a tongue should pray that he will be able to interpret.

14.verse: For if I pray in a tongue, my spirit prays but my mind is unproductive.

15.verse: What then shall I do? I will pray with my spirit, but I will also pray with my understanding. I will sing praises with my spirit, but I will also sing praises with my understanding.

16.verse: Otherwise, if you are praising God by the Spirit, how can anyone in the position of an outsider say, “Amen,” to your thanksgiving since he does not know what you are saying?

17.verse: For you are giving thanks well enough, but the other person is not being edified.

18.verse: I thank God I speak in tongues more than all of you;

19.verse: however, in church I would rather speak five words with my understanding, so as to instruct others also, than ten thousand words in a tongue.

20.verse: Brothers, do not be children in your thinking. Rather, in evil be infants but in your thinking be adults.

21.verse: In the Law it is written, “By people with strange tongues and by the lips of foreigners will I speak to this people, yet not even in this way will they listen to me, says the Lord.”

22.verse: So then tongues are for a sign, not for believers but for unbelievers, while prophecy is not for unbelievers but for believers.

23.verse: So if the whole church assembles in the same place and everyone is speaking in tongues, and outsiders or unbelievers come in, will they not say that you are out of your minds?

24.verse: But if all are prophesying, and an unbeliever or outsider comes in, he is convicted by all, he is called to account by all,

25.verse: and the secrets of his heart are laid bare. Thus he will fall on his face and worship God, declaring, “God is really among you.”

26.verse: What then is the outcome, brothers? When you come together, each one has a hymn, a word of instruction, a revelation, a tongue, an interpretation. Let all things be done for edification.

27.verse: If any speak in a tongue, it should be only two, or at the most three, and each in turn; and someone must interpret.

28.verse: But if there is no one who can interpret, the speaker should remain silent in church and speak to himself and to God.

29.verse: Two or three should speak as prophets and others should weigh carefully what is said.

30.verse: But if a revelation comes to another person who is sitting down, the first speaker should stop.

31.verse: For in this way all will be able to prophesy one by one, with the result that all may learn and all be encouraged,

32.verse: Indeed, the spirits of prophets are subject to prophets,

33.verse: for God is not a God of confusion but of peace. As in all the churches of the saints,

34.verse: the women are to be silent in the churches, for they are not permitted to speak. Rather, they are to be submissive, as in fact the law says.

35.verse: And if they want to find out about something, they should ask their own husbands at home; for it is improper for a woman to speak in church.

36.verse: Or did the word of God originate with you? Or did it come to you alone?

37.verse: If anyone considers himself to be a prophet or spiritual, let him acknowledge that what I am writing to you is a command of the Lord.

38.verse: If anyone fails to acknowledge this, he will not be acknowledged.

39.verse: So, my brothers, be eager to prophesy, and do not forbid speaking in tongues.

40.verse: But everything should be done in a proper and orderly way.

1.verse: Now I make known to you, brothers, the gospel that I preached to you, which also you received, in which also you stand,

2.verse: through which also you are being saved, if you hold firmly to the message I preached to you—unless you have believed in vain.

3.verse: For I passed on to you as of first importance what I also received: that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,

4.verse: and that he was buried, and that he has been raised on the third day according to the Scriptures,

5.verse: and that he appeared to Cephas, then to the twelve.

6.verse: Then he appeared to more than five hundred brothers at the same time, most of whom are still living, although some have fallen asleep.

7.verse: Then he appeared to James, then to all the apostles.

8.verse: Last of all, as to one abnormally born, he appeared even to me.

9.verse: For I am the least of the apostles, and I am not worthy to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.

10.verse: But by the grace of God I am what I am, and his grace toward me was not in vain. No, I worked harder than any of them—yet not I, but the grace of God that is with me.

11.verse: Whether then it was I or they, so we preach and so you came to believe.

12.verse: Now if Christ is proclaimed as raised from the dead, how can some of you say that there is no resurrection of the dead?

13.verse: But if there is no resurrection of the dead, not even Christ has been raised.

14.verse: And if Christ has not been raised, then our proclamation is groundless, and your faith is to no purpose.

15.verse: Beyond that, we are even found to be false witnesses about God, because we have borne witness about God that he raised Christ, whom he did not raise if it is true that the dead are not raised.

16.verse: For if the dead are not raised, not even Christ has been raised.

17.verse: And if Christ has not been raised, your faith is useless; you are still in your sins.

18.verse: Then those also who have fallen asleep in Christ have perished.

19.verse: If our hope in Christ is for this life only, we are of all men most to be pitied.

20.verse: But in fact Christ has been raised from the dead, the firstfruits of those who have fallen asleep.

21.verse: For since death came through a man, the resurrection of the dead also comes through a man.

22.verse: For just as in Adam all die, so also in Christ all will be made alive.

23.verse: But each in his own order: Christ, the firstfruits; then, those who belong to Christ, when he comes.

24.verse: Then comes the end, when he hands over the kingdom to God the Father, when he has destroyed every dominion, every authority and power.

25.verse: For he must reign until he has put all his enemies under his feet.

26.verse: The last enemy to be destroyed is death.

27.verse: For “he has put everything in subjection under his feet.” Now when it says that “everything has been put in subjection,” it is clear that this does not include the one who put everything in subjection to him.

28.verse: And when everything is subjected to him, then the Son himself will also be subjected to the one who subjected everything to him, so that God may be all in all.

29.verse: Otherwise, what will they accomplish, those who are being baptized for the dead? If the dead are not actually raised, why then are they being baptized for them?

30.verse: And why are we putting ourselves in danger every hour?

31.verse: Every day I am in danger of dying! I swear by my boasting in you, which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord.

32.verse: If as a mere man I fought with wild beasts at Ephesus, what have I gained? If the dead are not raised, let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die.

33.verse: Do not be deceived: “Bad company corrupts good morals.”

34.verse: Sober up as you ought, and stop sinning; for some have no knowledge of God. I say this to your shame.

35.verse: But someone will ask, “How are the dead raised? And with what kind of body will they come?”

36.verse: You fool! What you sow does not come to life unless it dies.

37.verse: And what you sow is not the body that is to be, but a bare seed, perhaps of wheat or something else.

38.verse: But God gives it a body as he has determined, and to each kind of seed its own body.

39.verse: Not all flesh is the same; people have one kind, animals another, birds another, fish another.

40.verse: And there are heavenly bodies and earthly bodies; but the glory of heavenly bodies is of one kind and the glory of earthly bodies is of another.

41.verse: The sun has one kind of glory, the moon another kind of glory, the stars another kind of glory; and star differs from star in glory.

42.verse: So also is the resurrection of the dead. The body is sown in a perishable state, it is raised imperishable.

43.verse: It is sown in humiliation, it is raised in glory; it is sown in weakness, it is raised in power;

44.verse: it is sown a natural body, it is raised a spiritual body. If there is a natural body, there is also a spiritual body.

45.verse: So also it is written, “The first man, Adam, became a living soul.” The last Adam became a life-giving spirit.

46.verse: However, the spiritual did not come first, but the natural, then the spiritual.

47.verse: The first man was of the earth, made of dust; the second man is of heaven.

48.verse: As was the man of dust, so also are those who are of dust; and as is the man of heaven, so also are those who are of heaven.

49.verse: And even as we have borne the image of the man of dust, let us also bear the likeness of the man of heaven

50.verse: Now this I declare, brothers, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God, nor does the perishable inherit the imperishable.

51.verse: Listen, I tell you a mystery: we will not all die, but we will all be changed—

52.verse: in an instant, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. For the trumpet will sound, and the dead will be raised imperishable, and we will be changed.

53.verse: For this perishable body must put on imperishability, and this mortal body must put on immortality.

54.verse: So when this perishable body puts on imperishability, and this mortal body puts on immortality, then the saying that is written will be fulfilled: “Death has been swallowed up in victory.”

55.verse: “Where, O death, is your victory? Where, O death, is your sting?”

56.verse: The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law.

57.verse: But thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ!

58.verse: So then, my dear brothers, be steadfast, immovable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, since you know that your labor is not in vain in the Lord.

1.verse: Now concerning the collection for the saints: as I directed the churches of Galatia, so you also are to do.

2.verse: On the first day of the week, each of you should put something aside as he may prosper and save it, so that when I come, collections will not have to be made.

3.verse: And when I arrive, I will dispatch with letters of introduction whomever you approve to carry your gift to Jerusalem.

4.verse: And if it seems advisable that I should go also, they will go with me.

5.verse: But I will come to you after I have gone through Macedonia—for I intend to go through Macedonia—

6.verse: and it may be that I will stay awhile with you, or even spend the winter, so that you can help me continue my journey, wherever I go.

7.verse: For I do not want to see you now just in passing, for I hope to spend some time with you, if the Lord permits.

8.verse: But I will stay in Ephesus until Pentecost,

9.verse: for a door that offers wide and effective ministry stands open for me, although there are many adversaries.

10.verse: Now if Timothy comes, see that he has nothing to fear while he is with you, for he is doing the Lord’s work, just as I am.

11.verse: So no one should treat him with contempt. Help him continue his journey in peace, that he may come to me; for I am expecting him with the brothers.

12.verse: Now concerning Apollos our brother: I strongly urged him to go to you with the other brothers, but it was not at all his intention to go now. He will go when he has an opportunity.

13.verse: Stay on guard, continue to stand firm in the faith, be men of courage, grow in strength.

14.verse: Everything you do should be done in love.

15.verse: You know that the household of Stephanus were the first converts in the province of Achaia, and that they devoted themselves to the service of the saints. So I urge you, brothers,

16.verse: that you also submit to such as these, and to everyone who assists in the work and labors in it.

17.verse: But I rejoice at the coming of Stephanas, Fortunatus, and Achaicus because they have supplied what was lacking from you,

18.verse: for they have refreshed my spirit and yours. Therefore recognize the worth of such men.

19.verse: The churches of Asia send their greetings to you. Aquila and Prisca, along with the church that meets in their house, send their special greetings in the Lord.

20.verse: All the brothers send you greetings. Greet one another with a holy kiss.

21.verse: This greeting is in my own hand, Paul.

22.verse: If anyone does not love the Lord, let him be accursed. Our Lord has come!

23.verse: May the grace of the Lord Jesus be with you.

24.verse: My love be with you all in Christ Jesus.
